text: Multiple variables can modified across() within mutate. syntax : `mutate(across(c(variable1, variable2), ~ function)) convert variables cd10, sox10 ck characters . inside .character(.) refers variables inside across().

title: Tables
text: use redcap_df example. Let us create simple table whole population present covariates age, sex tumor type 1 Age 2 Median (Q1, Q3) 49.7 (34.1, 64.5) 3 Range 10.8 - 88.8 4 Sex 5 Median (Q1, Q3) 1.0 (1.0, 2.0) 6 Range 1.0 - 2.0 7 Type 8 Median (Q1, Q3) 1.0 (1.0, 2.0) 9 Range 0.0 - 2.0 instantly conclude sex type incorrectly formatted, wish see percentages median 0/1 structure numeric. convert variables using factR() pipe tablR(). Notice pipe need specify data frame tablR() 1 Age 2 Median (Q1, Q3) 49.7 (34.1, 64.5) 3 Range 10.8 - 88.8 4 Sex 5 1 256 (51.2%) 6 2 244 (48.8%) 7 Type 8 1 254 (50.8%) 9 2 133 (26.6%) 10 0 113 (22.6%)
code: tablR(redcap_df,       vars = c(age, sex, type)) Overall (N=500) redcap_df %>%    factR(c(sex, type)) %>%    tablR(vars = c(age, sex, type)) Overall (N=500)

title: Tables
code: redcap_df %>%    factR(c(sex, type)) %>%    tablR(group = type,         vars = c(age, sex)) 1 (N=254)         2 (N=133)         0 (N=113) redcap_df %>%    factR(c(sex, type),         levels = list("type" = c("0", "1", "2"))) %>%    tablR(group = type,         vars = c(age, sex),         test = TRUE,         total = TRUE) var         0 (N=113)         1 (N=254)         2 (N=133)

title: Tables
text: possible rename three types labels: - Group names: labs.groups - Variable names: labs.headings - Variable labels/levels: labs.subheadings
code: redcap_df %>%   factR(c(type, sex)) %>%   tablR(     group = type,     vars=c(age, sex),     labs.groups = list("benign" = "0",                                      "in situ" = "1",                                      "malignant" = "2"),     labs.headings = list("Age at Debut" = "age"),     labs.subheadings = list("sex" = list("Female" = "2",                                          "Male" = "1"))) #>                         benign (N=113)   in situ (N=254) malignant (N=133) #> 1 Age at Debut                                                             #> 2    Median (Q1, Q3) 48.3 (31.8, 64.2) 49.6 (34.9, 66.0) 50.4 (34.8, 63.4) #> 3    Range              12.0 - 84.6       10.8 - 88.8       11.2 - 86.3    #> 4 Sex                                                                      #> 5    Female             47 (41.6%)        123 (48.4%)       74 (55.6%)     #> 6    Male               66 (58.4%)        131 (51.6%)       59 (44.4%)

code: tablR(   data,   group,   vars,   num.vars,   test = FALSE,   total = FALSE,   numeric = c("medianq1q3", "range"),   direction = "colwise",   reference = list(),   levels = list(),   labs.groups = list(),   labs.headings = list(),   labs.subheadings = list(),   reverse = F,   test.stats = c("kwt", "chisq"),   show.na = FALSE,   censur = F,   weights,   digits = 1,   simplify = list(),   simplify.remove = c("no", "0"),   print = F,   flextable = F )

title: Create frequency tables — tablR
text: data dataframe group Grouping variable. omitted single column tabel provided vars Variables grouping variable aggregated num.vars vector variables sorted based numerical order test Whether statistical tests performed (default = FALSE) total Whether total column included (default = FALSE) numeric Selection type stats numerical variables. Options include: median, q1q3, medianq1q3 (default), iqr, range, mean, sd, meansd, min, max) direction Direction percentages (colwise rowwise) reference List specifying reference group variable labs.headings List specifying labels variable names reverse whether order groups start highest level (default = T) test.stats Vector length 2 containing statistical tests performed show.na Whether NAs presented censur whether counts <= 3 censored weights optional name column containing weights weighted summaries digits number digits simplify list column names simplified dropping specified levels (e.g. 0 "") simple output. Groups size > 1 named : list("IHC" = c("cd10", "sox10", "ck"), "necrosis", "margins") simplify.remove vector labels removed columns assigned "simplify" argument. Default = c("", "0") print whether table printed console flextable whether table returned flextable labels List specifying labels specific labels variable
